post.author: MuD
post.body:
Hey all.

I have a standard model from poser that I exported as a 3DS file, but 3dsmax 6 wont open it, perhaps the version is too old. If someone has a later version of 3dsmax would you try opening it? If it works can you export the model as an ASE file for me? It would be appreciated alot! I will be trying it with 3dsmax 7 later on today. I have also included a lightwave export from poser, so if that works for someone can you do the same and export it as ASE?

Download

Perhaps another option would be a 3DS to ASE converter, but I havent found one so far.

What I want to do is bring the model in 3dsmax, edit it, build clothing and accessories for it, and use this as the high-poly version for normal map generation.

post.author: Lumpengnom
post.body:
I´m working with Max 8 and it works fine. I don´t have any webspace to upload it but i can send you a file if you pm me your email.

What would be better though is if you exported it to .obj instead of 3ds. Obj doesn´t triangulate and you won´t be stuck with stupid tris. Also, it might work.

post.author: MuD
post.body: Oops, I forgot to select import when opening the .3ds file, I was just opening it like a normal .max file. It works in 3dsmax 7, I will try 3dsmax 6 later. Thanks for the help anyway, I will have a look at .obj files.

post.author: Doomguy87
post.body:
i have 3ds max 9 and it wont open .3ds files. WTFF. this is where i got the models from http://www.archive3d.net

EDIT:nvm i should have looked one post up
